Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Brief:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic team at VentureDive. The ideal candidate will have over four years of hands-on experience in data science and machine learning, with a strong focus on time series forecasting and modeling what-if scenarios. You will work primarily with Microsoft Azure technologies, and a background in Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) will be highly advantageous.

VentureDive Overview:

Founded in 2012 by veteran technology entrepreneurs from MIT and Stanford, VentureDive is the fastest growing technology company in the region that develops and invests in products and solutions that simplify and improve the lives of people world-wide. We aspire to create a technology organization and an entrepreneurial ecosystem in the region that is recognized as second to none in the world.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement advanced time series forecasting models to predict trends and outcomes
Utilize Microsoft Azure for deploying and managing machine learning models
Conduct thorough data analysis/RCA to support business decisions and strategies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver insights
Mentor junior data scientists and provide guidance on best practices and methodologies
Ensure the ethical use of data in all projects and maintain high standards of data integrity
Work independently on complex projects with minimal supervision, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills
Be able to support the business unit across multiple projects where required
Able to come up with hypothesis to test models and understand requirements from a business perspective
Research upcoming trends and technologies to make improvements to the workings of the department


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in data science
Deep understanding of statistics and how ML algorithms work under the hood
Extensive experience with time series forecasting and modeling scenarios
Strong programming skills in Python using class and functional code
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Commitment to ethical behavior and maintaining high standards of data privacy and security
Ability to learn new technologies and get hands-on with large language models (LLMs), including understanding LLM architecture such as transformers


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry
Hands on experience of fine-tuning open sourced and closed sourced LLMS such as Llama, OpenAI and others
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure services and tools


In order to thrive at VentureDive, you

…are intellectually smart and curious

…have the passion for and take pride in your work

…deeply believe in VentureDive’s mission, vision, and values

…have a no-frills attitude

…are a collaborative team player

…are ethical and honest

Are you ready to put your ideas into products and solutions that will be used by millions?

You will find VentureDive to be a quick pace, high standards, fun and a rewarding place to work at. Not only will your work reach millions of users worldwide, you will also be rewarded with competitive salaries and benefits. If you think you have what it takes to be a VenDian, come join us ... we're having a ball!

Powered by JazzHR

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about both data science and (strategic) consulting? Do you like to create insights and turn them into action to create lasting impact? We are searching for an experienced Data Scientist for our Data & AI team to support our clients by combining business sense with data modelling. If this description fits your profile, we are looking for you!

The Data & AI team at IG&H is using the latest data and AI technology to help our clients innovate. To do so, our team of 25 data experts works closely together with our Technology and Sector teams. Through smart collaboration, we have delivered over 40 (Gen)AI projects in the last two years for our clients in Retail, Healthcare and Financial Services. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in truly understanding our client’s needs, translating this into value, creating solutions, developing Gen(AI) models and turning them into action. We believe it is key to have business sense as well as broad experience with data related topics (analytics, artificial intelligence, etc.) to create real business value. On top of that, you need to be able to communicate clearly and convincingly. Not only for effective project execution, but also to inspire (internal) stakeholders on the latest trends and developments in the field of Data and AI.

You will typically work in multidisciplinary project teams for one project at a time. Although being able to deliver work independently is appreciated, involvement of a project manager and technical experts ensures high-quality delivery and facilitates you to maintain a steep learning curve. We believe in diverse teams and diverse profiles in our Data & AI team. Some of our Data Scientists develop to be great consultants with technical knowledge and execution power, while others focus more on gaining deep technical expertise to deliver value from there. Working on a different range of projects in different sectors, you’ll be able to find your own sweet spot.

In addition, we believe that a caring and fun working environment will help you to dare to step out of your comfort zone and learn. We offer continuous learning through the IG&H Academy, in which you will get trainings to boost your data science, consulting and people skills. Also, you will be assigned a mentor, who will be there for you to provide you with guidance.

Above all, people are at the heart of what we do. This of course comes back in the work we deliver for our clients (why make a data product if the people who need to use it do not understand or want to use it?). At the same time, a fun working culture is key for who we are. With an inspiring office in Utrecht where we can connect, have abundant parties, team activities and sport events (both organized for the entire IG&H organization as well as specifically for the Data & Analytics team), IG&H is truly a Great Place To Work. And yes, we are certified!

Working for the Data & AI Team at IG&H Consulting is incredibly diverse, and fun at the same time. It’s been a great place to develop my technical know-how, management consulting skills and commercial effectivity. The team is young and ambitious, with a strong desire to solve complex puzzles, develop personally & professionally and do fun activities together. All in all, IG&H has been a great place to work for over 6 years already!

Lars van Kempen – Manager Data & AI

What you bring:

2+ years of relevant working experience at (among others) management consultancy firms, other professional services firms, and/or corporate data & AI teams
Python skills
Analytical, inventive and practical
A passion for Data & AI and the capability to translate business needs into impactful solutions
Drive to work in a fast-changing and high-demand, innovative environment
MSc degree, preferably in a technical field: e.g. Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics
You have excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch and English

What we offer:

An opportunity to help clients to transform to become data-driven and make an impact through data & analytics
Working at a Great Place to Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you, where we put people first and encourage new initiatives
Working with exciting new (disruptive) technologies and international teams
Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
Company car / good mobility scheme
Permanent contract
The possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
25 holiday days with the possibility to take up five more
The possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
IG&H facilitates a ‘"Health Human” program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life after having a child
Generous bonus scheme
And more, which we would love to elaborate on

WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors.

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

If this vacancy is right for you, then this is a great place to work, with super happy employees and clients. We’re still just embarking on this exciting adventure. Why not be part of it?

We’re truly committed to diversifying our workforce and actively encourage women to apply for this role!

Moreover, we want our employees to reflect the diversity of society. We work together with a remarkable mix of talents, personalities and cultures. IG&H is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to national origin, race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability or age. We care about individuality, but most importantly, we share the pride of our collective achievements and a Great Place to Work.

  • Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
  • Company car / good mobility scheme
  • Permanent contract

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
MLOps Engineer - Leading Investment Bank - The Hague - Hybrid remote - GenAI




Together with the Director of Data Analytics of a leading Investment Bank in The Hague, I'm looking for an MLOps Engineer / Advanced Analytics Engineer.




This is a key position in a new small dedicated Advanced Analytics team, where you can take a pivotal role in pushing risk & ML Models into production:




Your responsibilities:

Automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks and AzureML
Collaborate with data scientists and business stakeholders to ensure ML & AI models are production-ready and meet performance standards - advise them with your MLOps knowledge!
Provide and implement innovative solutions to automate the production of AI and ML models for Predictive AI in the Risk Department
Work on GenAI and predictive modelling/AI




Teck Stack: Risk Models, Python, MLOps, AzureML, DataBricks, MATLAB, GUI, DevOps, Software Engineering, ETL, CICD, GenAI, PredictiveAI




Your profile:

The ideal candidate has 2/3 years experience within MLOps, preferably within Credit Risk, banking sector
Proficient in Python and designing, developing and maintaining ML models (Machine Learning models)
You've worked with Databricks, Python, AzureML, Azure Factory
Exposure to MATLAB




Environment: greenfield Data Analytics department & Centre of Expertise. They focus on implementing GenAI + Predictive AI. This department holds the largest budget of the whole bank; Innovation and Investment is at its core.




The bank offers great benefits:

32 (!!) holidays
Hyrid working from The Hague office
Best pension in the Netherlands (+30% of annual salary)
Excellent Learning & Development programs
NS Business card 1st Class




Are you a Medior - Senior Machine Learning or Data Science Engineer / Software Engineer or Data Engineer - with experience within MLOps?




Please apply!

Title: junior data scientist
Description:
Werken als junior data scientist bij de politie betekent Nederland veiliger maken door de nieuwste big data-technologieën toe te passen. Wil jij ons helpen om big data een rol in het politiewerk te laten spelen?

Wat ga je doen?

De digitalisering van de maatschappij heeft grote maatschappelijke effecten en biedt kansen voor het aanpakken van maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is één van de technologieën die in hoog tempo wordt ontwikkeld en toegepast. Voor de politie biedt AI kansen om haar taak effectief uit te blijven voeren en om efficiënter te werken. De politie heeft AI dan ook aangemerkt als een van de sleuteltechnologieën die van belang is voor innovatie en de ontwikkeling van de organisatie.

Als junior data scientist bij Team Wetenschappelijke Ontwikkelingen (TWO) ga je de politieoperatie ondersteunen met behulp van AI. Dit doe je (onder andere) door wetenschappelijk onderzoek, dat wordt gedaan door promovendi bij het AI-lab, toe te passen op de politieoperatie. Daarnaast toon je initiatief om aan projecten, die vanuit de operatie komen, mee te werken en hierin de juiste data science of AI-oplossing toe te passen. Je gaat werken met verschillende soorten data zoals beeld en tekst. Hierin ben je op zoek naar nieuwe mogelijkheden en technieken om zo goed mogelijke resultaten te bereiken.

Het data wetenschappelijk werk is nog volop in ontwikkeling bij de politie. Daarom is het mogelijk dat er ook aanpalende werkzaamheden moeten worden verricht zoals data preparatie of business analyse.

Waar ga je werken?

Het Nationaal Politielab AI (NPAI) bestaat uit verschillende onderdelen. Een deel wat zich focust op wetenschappelijk onderzoek waar promovendi werkzaam zijn en het Team Wetenschappelijke Ontwikkelingen (TWO).

Wetenschappelijk onderzoek is de samenwerking van de politie met verschillende universiteiten (Universiteit Utrecht, de Universiteit van Amsterdam, en de TU Delft). Het doel van dit deel van het Politielab AI, is om samen met de wetenschap kennis op te bouwen en verantwoorde toepassingen te realiseren voor de politie met state-of-the-art AI. Hiertoe werken meerdere master studenten, promovendi (oftewel PhD-kandidaten), onderzoekers, postdocs en senior wetenschappers (waaronder hoogleraren) samen. Het wetenschappelijk onderzoek binnen het Politielab AI heeft een centrale rol in de ontwikkeling van AI binnen de politie. Op dit moment werken negentien promovendi in de wetenschappelijke tak van het Politielab.

Jij gaat werken bij Team Wetenschappelijke Ontwikkelingen. De primaire taak is de overdracht faciliteren van onderzoeken van promovendi naar inzet binnen de politie. Er werken momenteel elf medewerkers bij TWO.

Het TWO heeft een aantal taken


het vertalen van onderzoeksresultaten naar de operatie. Hiermee vormt TWO de brug tussen het wetenschappelijk onderzoek en de inzet binnen de politie.
het opbouwen (op basis van de onderzoeksagenda) van kennis en het maken van “verantwoorde” toepassingen (concepten) waar anderen middels experimenten op doorontwikkelen zoals de Dienst ICT en het programma Digitalisering.
het, waar nodig, begeleiden van experimenten en proeftuinen die onder leiding van het programma Digitalisering plaatsvinden.


Wie ben jij?

Als junior data scientist combineer jij je kennis van data en verschillende technieken met je enthousiasme om dit toe te passen binnen de politie. Je bent leergierig en vindt het belangrijk om bij te blijven in je vakgebied. Ook ben je proactief en waar je kansen ziet spreek je dit uit. Je weet dit te vertalen naar mogelijke nieuwe projecten om je collega’s te ondersteunen. Daarnaast vind je het belangrijk om in verbinding te staan met zowel de operationele collega’s als met mede data scientists. Met beide collega’s kun je goed communiceren en samenwerken. Hierdoor krijg je een goed beeld van de zaken die spelen en voor welke problemen bestaande oplossingen kunnen worden toegepast.

Daarnaast beschik je over


hbo werk- en denkniveau* bij voorkeur in een technische specialisatie zoals Artifical Intelligence, Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science of vergelijkbaar;
kennis met het toepassen van verschillende data science en AI toepassingen;
kennis en ervaring met Python;
werkervaring bij een (grote) overheidsinstelling, bij voorkeur in het veiligheidsdomein;
werkervaring in het opzetten van AI projecten en verandervraagstukken.
het is een pre als je beschikt over ervaring met Git, Kubernetes, CI/CD (devops), graph databases en Test Driven Development (TDD).


Wat wij bieden

De standplaats is Nieuwegein. Er is ruimte voor 1 fte. Het betreft een functie voor 36 uur per week. Omdat goede mensen belangrijk zijn binnen de politie investeren we in jouw toekomst. We bieden uitgebreide ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden en een aanstelling in tijdelijke dienst voor een proeftijd van een jaar. Bij voldoende functioneren wordt de aanstelling na een jaar omgezet in een vaste aanstelling.

Verder kun je het volgende van ons verwachten


een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3.484,- en maximaal € 5.489,- (schaal 10 Bbp) op basis van een 36-urige werkweek;
8% vakantie- en 8,33% eindejaarsuitkering;
goede pensioenregeling en betaald ouderschapsverlof ( meer info over verlof, regelingen en mogelijkheden ).


De formele functie binnen het functiegebouw van de politie is bedrijfsvoeringspecialist B , werkterrein digitale expertise.

Interesse?

Bel of mail met Judith Klepper, teamleider (06 -18 65 83 12, judith.klepper@politie.nl ) als je meer informatie over de functie wilt hebben.

Voor vragen over de sollicitatieprocedure bel of mail je met Marlou de Bruijn, recruiter (06 - 28 46 94 50, marlou.de.bruijn@politie.nl ).

Solliciteer uiterlijk 5 augustus 2024 via de sollicitatiebutton.

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld.

Wat verder belangrijk is


Een betrouwbaarheidsonderzoek maakt deel uit van de selectieprocedure.
De politie zet in op vernieuwing en cultuurverschillen binnen teams. Divers samengestelde teams presteren beter. Daarom werken we hard aan een open en veilige cultuur waarin divers talent tot bloei komt.
Je hebt een diploma op hbo-niveau (bachelor) of je bent daaraan gelijkgesteld via EVC. Of je hebt minimaal twee jaar aantoonbare ervaring op het gevraagde werk- en denkniveau. Dit moet je aantonen met je cv én een officiële functiebeschrijving of ander document waaruit blijkt dat de uitgevoerde functie op het gevraagde niveau is.


Show more
HTML:
Werken als junior data scientist bij de politie betekent Nederland veiliger maken door de nieuwste big data-technologieën toe te passen. Wil jij ons helpen om big data een rol in het politiewerk te laten spelen?

Wat ga je doen?

De digitalisering van de maatschappij heeft grote maatschappelijke effecten en biedt kansen voor het aanpakken van maatschappelijke vraagstukken. Artificial Intelligence (AI) is één van de technologieën die in hoog tempo wordt ontwikkeld en toegepast. Voor de politie biedt AI kansen om haar taak effectief uit te blijven voeren en om efficiënter te werken. Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I am currently working with an advertising powerhouse in Amsterdam, who are looking to add an experienced data scientist into their team to work on innovative solutions across the marketing space!




Responsibilities:




Analyze large and complex data sets to identify insights that can inform marketing strategies
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms to forecast customer behavior and campaign performance
Create and present dashboards and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders
Monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and ensure alignment with business objectives




Requirements:




- Strong knowledge of Data Science and Analytics

- 2+ years of professional experience

- Experience with dashboards is essential

- Experience with marketing mix models is beneficial but not required

- Affinity for machine learning is a plus




Salary Package:




• Up to €90,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours.

• Annual bonus. (usually 5-8%!)

• Pension scheme




Make sure to apply here or reach me on the following:




Phone: +31203997864

Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data scientist, Den Haag
Description:
White Space Energy is a (so far quite successful) young startup founded by a team of seasoned Oil&Gas professionals. We use state of the art deep learning techniques to assist customers with complex decision making across a broad portfolio including, a.o., logistics, maintenance, portfolio analysis and well design. We address these decision-making challenges by simulating business environments as complex games and by developing game agents to master these. The policies of the game agents then provide insight in how to optimize the customer’s decision strategy.

We are looking for an enthusiastic data scientist who is interested in joining our team to help develop game environments and agents on consultancy projects. To succeed you will need to have a strong affinity with problem solving, be delivery focused, and will need knowledge of and experience in machine/deep learning, preferably reinforcement learning.

About You

We highly value strong machine / deep learning engineers willing to help out with whatever moves our projects forward. You should have strong interpersonal skills and be a team player, flexible in adapting to changing requirements and able to cope with and reduce ambiguity. An ability to quickly understand, augment, test, and debug unfamiliar systems is valuable. A demonstrated interest in reinforcement learning is required. You should be fluent in Python.

Minimum Qualifications


– BS degree in computer science, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, machine learning or equivalent (MSc/PhD preferable).
– Strong knowledge and experience of Python.
– Knowledge of machine / deep learning, in particular reinforcement learning.
– Strong knowledge of algorithm design.
– Working knowledge of TensorFlow.
– Experience with data analysis.
– Previous interest in playing with and/or creating simulation models is a plus.

  • – Previous interest in playing with and/or creating simulation models is a plus.

Title: Data Scientist
HTML:
Do you feel a continuous hunger for data, complex analyses and the insights that come from it? Are you an expert in the field of data science, do you recognize patterns in marketing data and do you have experience with Marketing Mix Modelling? Do you want to continue to develop and challenge yourself by standing at the forefront of the use of modern tools, methods, technologies and enjoy wide variety of tasks in your job?


Annalect helps advertisers to improve data-driven marketing results and increase marketing efficiency. About half of the colleagues at Annalect are analysts or data scientists. We have expertise in the field of multi-touch attribution, marketing mix modeling, cross-media effect research and consumer behaviour. Together, we have the power to solve the most complex and relevant analysis issues. Annalect is part of the OmnicomMediaGroup and we work in the Netherlands for brands like Renault, L'Oréal, PepsiCo, McDonald's and many others.


What are you going to do?

As a Data Scientist at Annalect, you will be responsible for developing and using state-of-the-art analytical solutions and making a measurable impact by the usage of our data sources. Working with big data is just a beginning, as its extensivity is an important factor in many of our solutions. For example, you will work on:

  • Marketing Mix Modeling, in which you investigate which media mix is most effective for our clients.
  • Decision trees that provide insight into how people make a certain purchase decision.
  • Clustering models that provide insight into the different ways people perceive and interacting with ads.


As a Data Scientist, you are constantly challenged to use complex methods to help our customers achieve their goals. You combine flawless execution with the ability to explain complex solutions in understandable manner to customers and colleagues


What we look for:

  • A love for data, complex analyses and the insights that come from them;
  • 3-5 years of experience in a data scientist role, preferably within marketing;
  • Very thorough knowledge of programming statistical analyses in R or Python;
  • Experience working with mainstream database systems such as PostgreSQL, Spark, or Hive;
  • Strive to get the most out of data and technology. Both in terms of content, by bringing out the sharpest insights, and in terms of technology, by automating processes as much as possible;
  • A drive to collaborate, both within OMG and beyond;
  • Good communication and presentation skills. You should be able to oversee the implications of customer questions and discuss them with other specialists;
  • You like to share your knowledge and skills with others, dedicate the time to level up the team.


What we offer:


  • A good salary and terms of employment based on 37,5 hours per week;
  • A great job in an innovative environment where technology, data and analytics are the core, and no two days are the same;
  • opportunity to fully focus on developing your expertise within marketing mix modelling, attribution and experimentation;
  • The opportunity to further scale up our fast-growing partnerships with Meta and Google, with plenty of room for your own initiative;
  • Being part of a multi disciplinary and multi cultural team of highly talented specialists who want to share their knowledge with you, but also want to learn from you;
  • An international data science community where you can spar about innovations that have a global impact;
  • 27 days of holiday + 2 days off (Diversidays);
  • Facilitating a home workplace;
  • Flexible working hours and hybrid working;
  • Possibility to work abroad 6 weeks a year;
  • Take unlimited courses via Onelearning;
  • And more! :)


*Please note that we are not an official IND sponsor at the moment.


Let´s go!


If you would like to know more about this position, please contact Talent Acquisition via werken@omnicommediagroup.com or to Monica Miziolek via monika.miziolek@annalect.com.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
I'm partnered with a large manufacturing company based around the Randstad region hiring for a Data Scientist.




Working closely with cross-functional teams, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical modeling to extract insights, solve complex problems, and inform decision-making. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic scale-up company at the forefront of ethical AI innovation.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources to ensure accuracy, completeness, and consistency.
Apply advanced statistical techniques and machine learning algorithms to analyze data and extract actionable insights.
Stay current with the latest research and developments in the fields of data science, machine learning, and AI ethics, and contribute to the company's knowledge base and best practices.
Adhere to ethical principles and guidelines in the development and deployment of AI systems, ensuring fairness, transparency, and accountability.




Qualifications:

Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field with a focus on data analysis and machine learning.
3+ years of experience working as a Data Scientist or a similar role, preferably in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, as well as experience with data manipulation and analysis libraries (e.g., pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn).
Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work independently as well as part of a multidisciplinary team.
Passion for ethical AI and a commitment to promoting fairness, transparency, and accountability in AI systems.




Benefits:

Gross salary: €80,000+
Company Car + fuel card.
Opportunities for professional development and career advancement.
A supportive and inclusive work environment that values diversity, equity, and inclusion.




Feel free to contact for more details:

Email: daniel.zelnis@vividresourcing.com

  • Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
  • Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
  • Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.

Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications

  • Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
  • Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
  • Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
  • Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
  • Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch

Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:

  • This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.

Preferred/Additional Qualifications

  • Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
  • Experience with text summarization and/or text generation

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: AI and Software Engineer
Description:
At Cordys, our mission is clear: to drive the widespread adoption of artificial intelligence in cardiovascular ECG diagnostics. By doing so, we aim to enhance the well-being and extend the life expectancy of patients while significantly reducing costs in healthcare systems globally. If this mission resonates with you, we invite you to join us on this journey.

As part of the Cordys team, you'll play a vital role in developing cutting-edge AI solutions that revolutionize the diagnosis of heart diseases such as myocardial infarction and heart failure. Our goal is to empower doctors with advanced tools that enable earlier and more accurate diagnoses, ultimately leading to improved patient outcomes.

We are currently seeking driven and motivated individuals to join our engineering team. In this role, you will be instrumental in designing and implementing the software that drives our innovative products forward. If you're passionate about making a meaningful impact in healthcare and thrive in a dynamic and collaborative environment, we want to hear from you.

What Your Responsibilities Would Look Like


Design, develop, and test the code that powers our products
Finetune and optimize our machine learning models
Bring machine learning models into production using our cloud-based platform
Build robust integrations between our platform and third-party APIs
Build a web-based user interface for medical professionals



Requirements


Citizenship in an EU/EEA member state or possession of a valid work permit for the Netherlands. Applications that do not meet this requirement will not be considered.
You currently call the Netherlands home or are open to relocating there
Bachelor's degree or equivalent education in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Artificial Intelligence, or related field.
Demonstrated experience (2+ years) in software development or machine learning.
Proficiency in Python and preferably PyTorch.


A plus would be


Hands-on experience with quality management, including ISO-13485, ISO-62304, and ISO-27001, and familiarity with medical device regulations in Europe, such as the MDR.
Previous experience working in a startup or scale-up environment.
Proficiency in DevOps and MLOps, supporting the entire lifecycle of AI-powered software products, including data preparation, model training, testing, inference, bug tracking, monitoring, and documentation.
Knowledge of ECG modeling and analysis, including input modalities, common tasks, organs, tools, formats, standards, models, pitfalls, literature, etc



Benefits


Competitive pay ranging from €50k to €75k
Join our employee equity plan and become a stakeholder in our company's success
An exciting, dynamic engineering role within a cutting-edge medtech startup
A meaningful purpose: our innovations save lives and cut healthcare expenses by aiding healthcare professionals in diagnosing complex conditions such as myocardial infarction, heart failure, and atrial fibrillation, benefitting patients and society
A flat organizational structure where your insights are valued and influence our direction
A supportive environment with a positive atmosphere, prioritizing work-life balance
Flexible hours, remote work opportunities, and an inspiring office located at UtrechtInc incubator on the university campus, near Utrecht's charming city center
25 days of annual leave (plus additional public holidays)
Show more

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations to achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Act as technical leader for internationalization efforts in other EU markets/languages.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German or Dutch
Demonstrated technical leadership in AI products and services


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft CloudBackground Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us:

MetrixLab is a fast-growing global market research and insights company that’s challenging the status quo of insights. By blending evolving technology with passionate experts, MetrixLab helps global and local brands to drive more impact, and forges partnerships to drive sustainably equitable growth. From creative testing to brand tracking, and packaging to e-commerce optimization, MetrixLab’s range of solution suites adapts to fit all types of budgets, timelines and business needs.




Active in more than 90 countries, MetrixLab is a proud partner to more than half of the world’s top 100 brands and part of Toluna.




About the role:

Would you like to become part of a rapidly growing team with an exceptional client roster? We are seeking an ambitious Data Scientist to help drive the success and continued growth of MetrixLab. Primary objective of the role is to help the team design and deliver new analytical solutions to help our roster of clients.




To realize these commercial targets, you will:

Develop and execute marketing research analytical models
Help generate new data driven insights for clients.
Ensure a best fit solution that aligns with the client objective by providing analytic consulting and primary market research expertise
Know the methodology for each analytic techniques and communicate data insights and findings from them
Drive standardization and automation through ML-ops.




Competencies:

Degree in Engineering/Maths/Physics
2-5 years of experience with marketing data science analysis, with an emphasis on discrete choice modelling/conjoints (in Sawtooth), but also covering max-diffs, drivers analysis, dimensionality reduction
Very good command of English




What do we offer?

A challenging position in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, quickly growing global company.
A flexible work environment with a focus on owning and taking pride in your work.
(International) growth opportunities in line with your career ambitions and passions.
An open-culture work environment staffed with ambitious colleagues with “can-do” mentalities.
Global onboarding and frequent internal training and sharing opportunities.
Our employees have exclusive access to Udemy Business. With our company license, you have unlimited access to all external courses.
A competitive salary package including a good pension scheme, 25 paid days of leave, and full travel reimbursement (yes, that includes cycling!).
An amazing, stylish office space, delicious lunch (with a salad bar), and perfect coffee. MetrixLab’s Rotterdam location is in one of the city’s most trendy areas, close to the Hotel New York—where we have weekly (and free!) Friday afternoon drinks.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer - Utrecht Omgeving - Retail - Fulltime




Breng dit data team naar een hoger niveau met je expertise in ML/AI! en jij een expert in het benutten van AI/ML en kun je Data Scientists helpen bij het ontwikkelen en onderhouden van productieklare modellen? Als ML Engineer ben je onderdeel van het data analytics team voor een grote retailer in Nederland. Jij bent de specialist in MLOps en Cloud Computing, verantwoordelijk voor het productieklaar maken van AI/ML-oplossingen. Hiermee sla je de brug tussen de Data Scientists en de technologie (Azure/Databricks). Samen met je collega's (data scientists, consultants, analisten en engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistiek, assortimentsoptimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM.




Werkzaamheden:




Je werkt samen met het Data Science-team om sterke AI/ML-modellen te creëren, waarbij je zorgt voor grondige monitoring van de proces-, data- en modelkwaliteit om fouten en verkeerde voorspellingen te voorkomen.
Je biedt advies en oplossingen voor technische uitdagingen die zich tijdens het ontwikkelingsproces voordoen.
Als specialist in MLOps en CI/CD onderhoud en verbeter je continu de modellen.
Je fungeert als verbindingspersoon tussen Data Science en Global IT voor het gebruik van technologieën zoals Databricks en Azure, die door Global IT worden beheerd.
Je draagt actief bij aan de vooruitgang van technologie en tools door het ontwikkelen van utility packages en het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps-methodologie.
Je blijft op de hoogte van innovaties binnen MLOps en bepaalt hoe deze kunnen bijdragen aan de doelen.







Wat zit erin voor jou?




Een dynamische omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren en plezier hebt door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling.
Een competitief salaris, afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding
24 vakantiedagen en extra dagen op fulltime basis.
Mogelijkheid tot 19 extra vakantiedagen + mogelijkheid tot kopen of verkopen van vakantiedagen
Korting bij de retailer zelf
Leer- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met een interne academy.
2-3 dagen per week vanuit huis kunnen werken, flexibele uren
Kilometer vergoeding voor reis naar het kantoor.




Wie ben jij?

3+ jaar ervaring als ML Engineer of Data Scientist met affiniteit voor ML
Expertise in Python, PySpark en SQL
Ervaring met MLOps/ CI/CD cyclus en Git
Werken in scrumteams
Kennis van Databricks en Azure
Teamspirit en kunnen sparren met je collega's om zo mogelijke oplossingen voor te leggen.
Vloeiend in Nederlands en Engels




Ben jij de juiste fit? Neem nu contact op :)

Show more

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist AI
HTML:
CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.


Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.


Wat breng jij mee?

  • Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;
  • Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;
  • Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;
  • Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);
  • Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;
  • Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;
  • Een geldig rijbewijs B.


Wat bieden wij?

  • Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.
  • Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.
  • Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;
  • € 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;
  • Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI
  • 25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;
  • Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;
  • Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.


Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?

Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.


Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
DATA SCIENTIST / ANALYST - Utrecht area - Hybrid way of working - 12 months with a possibility for an extension!







*Only candidates living in the Netherlands are considered for this position*




Are you a Data Scientist or Analyst with experience in Python and PySpark? If so, this opportunity might be perfect for you!




Amoria Bond is currently seeking multiple Data Scientists and Analysts with expertise in Python and PySpark to join our key clients in the Utrecht area. In this role, you will help the team perform, execute, and excel in their tasks.




The ideal candidate will have expertise in:

Data Analytics
Python
PySpark
Azure (Preferred)
Dutch speaking




There are two distinct roles available. In addition to the basic requirements listed above, we are looking for candidates interested in:




Business/Stakeholder-focused Role: Ideal candidates will have experience in business knowledge and stakeholder management.
Technical Hands-on Role: Ideal candidates will focus on back-end analysis; stakeholder management is not required.







Are you the Data Scientist/Analyst that we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to meel.polkki@amoriabond.com and I will contact you as soon as I can!




We will endeavour to respond to your application ASAP. However, there may be times when it is not possible to reply to all applications, due to high volumes of enquiries. This is sometimes the case for unsuccessful applications to one of our vacancies. We apologise for this and can reassure you that we will keep your details and contact you in the future should any suitable positions arise.




Amoria Bond operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Please choose from the Role Library, plus any other HM-determined qualifications (please ensure they are quantifiable)
Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Looking for a role that blends Software Engineering with Machine Learning?




Want to work in a super modern stack on a real-time, global product?




Our client's looking for a Python Engineer to join the team with Machine learning experience.




You'll focus on building API's and deploying the models created by scientists into production. The role is therefore a mix of a Python Engineer & Machine Learning Engineer, otherwise known as MLOps.




The product is extremely innovative, complex and used all over the world!




Essential Experience




Strong Python experience writing API's
Machine learning experience - specifically deploying models created by Data Scientists into production (MLOps)
Docker
Relational / Non-Relational Databases
Public cloud
At least 2 years experience




Beneficial Experience




Kubernetes
Big Data experience
MongoDB
Event Driven Architecture
Real-time experience
Airflow




Start - Next 2-3 months




Salary - 70-85K including the 8% holiday allowance




Hybrid - 2 days a week working at the office in Amsterdam (Tuesday & Thursday)




This company can provide visa sponsorship and 30%




NOTE - You must already be in the Netherlands




Interested to know more information - apply now!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Science Consultant at Data Tribes – For Data-Driven Solutions




About Data Tribes

Welcome to the green world of Data Tribes! We are a company that values community, fun, and shared growth. Here, you are not just a title or a degree; you are potential waiting to be discovered. We give you the chance to learn by doing, to grow, and to develop.




Your Role

As a Data Science Consultant at Data Tribes, you play a crucial role in transforming complex business problems into concrete solutions. You will work with a dynamic Amsterdam-based startup that is on a mission to help clients fully leverage their data potential—quickly, easily, and accurately.




Responsibilities

Convert user requirements into state-of-the-art products.
Develop dashboards, reports, and algorithms to transform structured and unstructured data into actionable insights.
Use storytelling to visualize data, making information more accessible and impactful.
Perform roles such as Data Analyst, Storyteller, or Data Scientist, leading projects and captivating clients with your deliverables.




Qualifications

At least two years of work experience and a degree at the HBO or university level.
Experience with visualisations in Power BI, Tableau, or SAS VA/Viya.
Knowledge of Microsoft Azure/Synapse and SAS is a plus.
Familiarity with R, Python, Spark, Scala, Hadoop, Hbase, MongoDB, AeroSpike, AWS, Tensorflow, Matlab is a plus.
Understanding of Topic Modeling, Recurrent Neural Networks, Generative Adversarial Networks, Deep Learning, Word Embedding, Tree-Based Models, Dimensional Reduction, Clustering, Optimisation, and Statistical & Machine Learning Methods is a plus.




What We Offer

Extensive training and courses to support personal and professional development.
A competitive salary with comprehensive benefits.
Mobility budget.
Monthly internet allowance.
Hybrid working options.
Laptop and phone reimbursement.
25 vacation days per year.




Our Culture

At Data Tribes, we prioritise safety and comfort, ensuring you feel as at home as in your favourite hoodie. We believe in combining work with lively and respectful discussions, which often lead to the coolest ideas and innovations. Our startup is dedicated to helping clients achieve their sustainability goals through data-driven solutions, making a lasting green impact. Join us to transform the world with your data expertise.




Are We a Match?

We seek passionate individuals to collaborate with us on our ambitions. Are you looking for a challenge and a place to learn and grow? If so, we want to hear from you!




Apply Now

Ready to join our team as a Data Science Consultant? We’d love to hear from you! Apply now and be part of Data Tribes, driving change and making the world greener.
