Title: Software Engineer
Description:
This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.

End Date

Tuesday 16 July 2024

Salary Range

£45,954 - £68,931

We support flexible working – click here for more information on flexible working options

Flexible Working Options

Hybrid Working

Job Description Summary

Job Description

JOB TITLE: Software Engineer – Stockbroking Lab (.Net & ASP)

SALARY: The salary banding for this role is £45,954 - £51,060

LOCATION: Leeds or Edinburgh

HOURS: 35 hours, full time

WORKING PATTERN: Our work style is hybrid, which involves spending at least two days per week, or 40% of our time, at one of our office sites.

About This Opportunity

As a Software Engineer within the Stockbroking Lab, you’ll collaborate with agile teams to drive iterative change safely for the Group and our customers. You’ll work on a variety of initiatives, ensuring that the products we deliver meet quality standards and positively impact our customers. Your role will involve turning requirements into actionable stories, managing code changes, and contributing to the production release process.

Key Responsibilities


Participate in agile ceremonies (daily team synchronization, backlog planning, prioritization, and retrospectives)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including the Customer Journey Managers, Product Owners, Technical Delivery Managers and other Software Engineers
Support build and test processes
Assist with live planning and address service incidents
Productionising code via our DevOps pipeline
Apply problem-solving skills to find innovative solutions


You must be happy to support the on-call rota for applications within your area of technical expertise.

Why Lloyds Banking Group

Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms. We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture. If you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to the recruitment process, just let us know.

What You’ll Need


A strong, proven, and consistent track record when developing in Microsoft technologies (.NET and ASP)
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server
Experience in managing source code with GitHub
Experience in DevOps tooling (Jenkins, Urban Code and Sonarqube)
Strong problem-solving abilities related to code and database performance.
Ability to translate business requirements into technical stories and communicate updates effectively.
Willingness to take on tasks beyond your engineering discipline to support team goals.
Comfortable working in a multi-disciplinary team, engaging with product owners, fellow engineers, and technical delivery managers


And Any Experience Of These Would Be Really Useful


Any experience in Oracle PL/SQL, Oracle RAC technology and shell scripting in Linux would be beneficial
Understanding of agile tools to manage feature team activity (JIRA and Confluence)
Experience integrating applications with 3rd party owned systems and shared Group services
Knowledge of governance practices to ensure safe change implementation.


Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms.

We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.

We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.

And it’s why we especially welcome applications from underrepresented groups.

We’re disability confident. So if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know

We also offer a wide ranging benefits package, which includes:


A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
An annual performance related bonus
Share schemes including free shares
Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
28 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies


Want to do amazing work, that’s interesting and makes a difference to millions of people? Join our journey.

At Lloyds Banking Group, we're driven by a clear purpose; to help Britain prosper. Across the Group, our colleagues are focused on making a difference to customers, businesses and communities. With us you'll have a key role to play in shaping the financial services of the future, whilst the scale and reach of our Group means you'll have many opportunities to learn, grow and develop.

We keep your data safe. So, we'll only ever ask you to provide confidential or sensitive information once you have formally been invited along to an interview or accepted a verbal offer to join us which is when we run our background checks. We'll always explain what we need and why, with any request coming from a trusted Lloyds Banking Group person.

We're focused on creating a values-led culture and are committed to building a workforce which reflects the diversity of the customers and communities we serve. Together we’re building a truly inclusive workplace where all of our colleagues have the opportunity to make a real difference.

Title: Software Engineer - Frontend
Description:
Software Engineer - Frontend

Leeds – hybrid/flexible

Salary: £45k - £65k D.O.E + benefits package




Fruition IT are working with a well-established tech-first business who are embarking on a complete technical transformation. This client is looking to bring in a team of Software Engineers to work on a bespoke software platform as part of the business growth.




The Frontend Software Engineer will be responsible for working in a creative environment to build the frontend platform to industry standards. You will be working with scripting languages such as JavaScript and Typescript, spun up into an AWS platform.




What will I be doing?

Developing web applications and systems using JavaScript, React and Typescript.
Define and analyse business requirements.
Support continuous improvement and integrations to enhance deployment.
Collaborate with engineers, architects and tested to develop unit code.
Working in an AWS environment




Key requirements:

JavaScript development, for at least 3 years.
Experience with JavaScript frameworks such as TypeScript and React.
Experience with NodeJS.
Understanding of terraform as infrastructure as code.
Working with REST and GraphQL.
Agile ways of working (Scrum/Kanban).
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a team and to your own initiative.




If this role sounds of interest, please apply and someone will be in touch regarding the role.




We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Title: Software Engineer - Back End
Description:
Job Title: Software Engineer – Back End

Salary: £68,202 - £83,358 pa.

Location: Edinburgh, Manchester, Leeds, Halifax, Bristol

Hours: Full time

Working Pattern: Hybrid, 40% (or two days) in the office per week







About us




We’re on an exciting journey to transform our Group and the way we’re shaping finance for good. We’re focusing on the future, investing in our technologies, workplaces, and colleagues to make our Group a great place for everyone. Including you!







About this opportunity




If you think all banks are the same, you'd be wrong. We're an innovative, fast-changing business that's shaping finance as a force for good. A bank that's empowering its people to innovate, explore possibilities and grow with purpose. Together, we’re here to help Britain prosper – putting the ever-evolving needs of our customers at the heart of everything we do, as they move through their financial life with us.




Across Consumer Relationship Platforms we’ve achieved so much in recent years, building our strong brands into thriving ones, the UK’s biggest digital bank and the widest branch network. Our multi-service, multi-brand offer is a unique strength, and we will work hard to ensure our brands continue to grow and succeed.




The way our customers want to deal with us is continuing to change, and they are telling us they need more from us. They need a seamless digital experience, with personalised products and services at their fingertips.




Are you passionate about technology and its application to real-world problems? Can you Build strong relationships and work efficiently with others across a variety of domains, fields and locations. Across our Engineering teams, we’re creating new opportunities and products to improve customer experiences for years to come.




We’re always looking for good Software Engineers! You’ll be taken through a centralised application, technical testing, and interviewing process, then if successful offered one of our available roles depending on your chosen location.




We currently have a number of Software Engineering positions available across a range of locations in the UK.







About the role




Work as part of a self-organised engineering team to design and develop software features or services that are delightful and vital in our mission to help Britain prosper.
Be at the heart of delivery in your team building features with a passion for evolving best practices within your community.
Work with the product and engineering leads to achieve the vision and customer outcomes for your Lab, through writing well-factored and tested code.
Be curious about technology and understanding how things work. You'll influence positively demonstrating the right values and behaviours as we improve how we deliver.
You'll love to solve Customer problems using technology and Engineering practices
You'll lead, direct and shape approaches to solving technical challenges and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
Build efficient and reusable back-end systems and abstractions.







What you’ll need




Essential




Design and develop applications in Java with automated tests to ensure it meets business functionality
Experience with Golang, including developing, testing and maintaining applications
Use the Spring Boot framework for building our Microservices
Hands-on experience working with APIs
Experience with DevOps practices, including continuous integration, continuous development (CI/CD) and infrastructure as code (IaC)




Desirable




Good knowledge using modern technologies e.g. SQL Databases etc.
Experience with Public Cloud Solution, ideally GCP or AZURE
Diverse technical experience and a proven ability to deliver high quality applications at scale
Agile experience and excellent problem-solving skills
Strong experience of the entire software development lifecycle and experience in delivery of software.
You’re able to effectively communicate and work together across engineering to maximise inner-sourcing opportunities and reduce waste







About working for us




Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms.




We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.




We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.




And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups.




We’re disability confident. So, if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.




We also offer a wide-ranging benefits package, which includes:




A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
An annual bonus award, subject to Group performance
Share schemes including free shares
Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies




Ready for a career where you can have a positive impact as you learn, grow and thrive? Apply today and find out more.

HTML:
Job Title: Software Engineer – Back End

Salary: £68,202 - £83,358 pa.

Location: Edinburgh, Manchester, Leeds, Halifax, Bristol

Hours: Full time

Working Pattern: Hybrid, 40% (or two days) in the office per week



About us


We’re on an exciting journey to transform our Group and the way we’re shaping finance for good. We’re focusing on the future, investing in our technologies, workplaces, and colleagues to make our Group a great place for everyone. Including you!



About this opportunity


If you think all banks are the same, you'd be wrong. We're an innovative, fast-changing business that's shaping finance as a force for good. A bank that's empowering its people to innovate, explore possibilities and grow with purpose. Together, we’re here to help Britain prosper – putting the ever-evolving needs of our customers at the heart of everything we do, as they move through their financial life with us.


Across Consumer Relationship Platforms we’ve achieved so much in recent years, building our strong brands into thriving ones, the UK’s biggest digital bank and the widest branch network. Our multi-service, multi-brand offer is a unique strength, and we will work hard to ensure our brands continue to grow and succeed.


The way our customers want to deal with us is continuing to change, and they are telling us they need more from us. They need a seamless digital experience, with personalised products and services at their fingertips.


Are you passionate about technology and its application to real-world problems? Can you Build strong relationships and work efficiently with others across a variety of domains, fields and locations. Across our Engineering teams, we’re creating new opportunities and products to improve customer experiences for years to come.


We’re always looking for good Software Engineers! You’ll be taken through a centralised application, technical testing, and interviewing process, then if successful offered one of our available roles depending on your chosen location.


We currently have a number of Software Engineering positions available across a range of locations in the UK.



About the role


  • Work as part of a self-organised engineering team to design and develop software features or services that are delightful and vital in our mission to help Britain prosper.
  • Be at the heart of delivery in your team building features with a passion for evolving best practices within your community.
  • Work with the product and engineering leads to achieve the vision and customer outcomes for your Lab, through writing well-factored and tested code.
  • Be curious about technology and understanding how things work. You'll influence positively demonstrating the right values and behaviours as we improve how we deliver.
  • You'll love to solve Customer problems using technology and Engineering practices
  • You'll lead, direct and shape approaches to solving technical challenges and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
  • Build efficient and reusable back-end systems and abstractions.



What you’ll need


Essential


  • Design and develop applications in Java with automated tests to ensure it meets business functionality
  • Experience with Golang, including developing, testing and maintaining applications
  • Use the Spring Boot framework for building our Microservices
  • Hands-on experience working with APIs
  • Experience with DevOps practices, including continuous integration, continuous development (CI/CD) and infrastructure as code (IaC)


Desirable


  • Good knowledge using modern technologies e.g. SQL Databases etc.
  • Experience with Public Cloud Solution, ideally GCP or AZURE
  • Diverse technical experience and a proven ability to deliver high quality applications at scale
  • Agile experience and excellent problem-solving skills
  • Strong experience of the entire software development lifecycle and experience in delivery of software.
  • You’re able to effectively communicate and work together across engineering to maximise inner-sourcing opportunities and reduce waste



About working for us


Our focus is to ensure we're inclusive every day, building an organisation that reflects modern society and celebrates diversity in all its forms.


We want our people to feel that they belong and can be their best, regardless of background, identity or culture.


We were one of the first major organisations to set goals on diversity in senior roles, create a menopause health package, and a dedicated Working with Cancer initiative.


And it’s why we especially welcome applications from under-represented groups.


We’re disability confident. So, if you’d like reasonable adjustments to be made to our recruitment processes, just let us know.


We also offer a wide-ranging benefits package, which includes:


  • A generous pension contribution of up to 15%
  • An annual bonus award, subject to Group performance
  • Share schemes including free shares
  • Benefits you can adapt to your lifestyle, such as discounted shopping
  • 30 days’ holiday, with bank holidays on top
  • A range of wellbeing initiatives and generous parental leave policies


Ready for a career where you can have a positive impact as you learn, grow and thrive? Apply today and find out more.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Place: Sherburn In Elmet, England, United Kingdom
Description:
We’re looking for an enthusiastic and talented Full-Stack Developer (PHP/Vue). The sort of person who’s looking for a career where they can make their mark, surrounded by a tech-obsessed team who are transforming the student IT experience with cutting-edge solutions.

AppsAnywhere is an EdTech company making big waves in our industry, thanks to awesome products and a passion for our customers. Over the last 10 years, we’ve worked hard creating and developing the world’s first app store designed specifically for education.

You will be joining our small AppsAnywhere product dev team, working on both frontend (Vue) and backend (PHP) aspects of our stack and using your eye for great user interface design to help build the next generation of a product used all around the world to deliver an awesome experience to over 2.5 million students!




The role will be hybrid with 2 days in our awesome Sherburn-in-Elmet office (which used to be a pub! FYI - we have kept the bar for our regular social evenings/events) during normal office hours and 3 days remote.




As a Full Stack Developer, you’ll be responsible for:

Participating in the entire software development lifecycle, from concept and design to testing and deployment.
Writing well-structured, efficient, and maintainable PHP applications using frameworks and libraries (e.g. Symfony, Laminas and Mezzio).
Creating user-facing features using Vue for interactive web applications.
Writing and maintaining unit and integration test suites (e.g. PHPUnit, Vitest, Cypress).
Collaborating with team members to brainstorm solutions, share knowledge, and contribute to technical discussions.
Using design tools like Sketch to create mockups, prototypes, and UI elements.




To join our team, the following skills are required:




Essential

3+ years of experience developing backend PHP applications with a PHP framework.
2+ years of experience building interactive frontend applications with JavaScript/Vue.
Solid understanding of web technologies including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript (ES6+).
Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
Knowledge of database design and SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL).
Experience using design tools such as Sketch for creating UI/UX elements.
Understanding of RESTful API design and integration.
Design sensibilities to create attractive and intuitive user interfaces.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to articulate ideas and collaborate effectively with team members.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and frameworks.
Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively in a small team environment
Comfortable working in a Linux/macOS environment (e.g., terminal, bash).




Desirable

Experience with Symfony, Mezzio or Laminas PHP frameworks.
Experience with using Doctrine for database interactions.
Vue integration/Component testing (Cypress)
Using Sketch to create UI designs.
Working with OpenAPI specifications.
Optimising web UIs for different device types.
Familiarity with Cloud native technologies and design patterns (AWS, Azure).
Working as part of an Agile team (Scrum/Kanban).
Using Jira for tracking work.
Symfony, Vue.js or similar relevant certifications.




Why AppsAnywhere?

As well as fantastic office space, we offer excellent benefits including:

Unlimited paid holidays!
Healthcare cash plan which provides money towards dental costs, eyecare costs, counselling and discounted gym memberships & a range of high-street stores.
Private medical insurance
5 paid days leave to do volunteer/charity work
Paid training and development




Working with awesome industry-leading tech is just one reason you’ll love this role. Recently voted runners-up for the Techworld Best Place to Work in Tech Award, our small and dynamic team love their work, and so will you!

100% employee NPS score 2019 the best place to work in EdTech!
Techworld EdTech techies 2018 Best Place to Work in Tech Finalist
Techworld EdTech techies 2018 Innovator of the Year Finalist
Exclusive purveyor of Gartner Cool Vendor solutions
Really fun folks that “get it” and embrace our inner-geek!

Show more

Title: Power Apps Test Engineer
Description:
Power Apps Test Engineer

Contract Type: Inside IR35

Rate: £450/day

Duration: 4 Months

Location: Remote with potential travel to Leeds




Brio is working with a leading provider of innovative technology solutions in the public sector. We seek a Senior Test Analyst with Automation expertise for a four-month contract. Ideally, you will have worked as a consultant within the public sector.




As an Automation Test Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of software solutions. You will work closely with development teams, project managers, and stakeholders to design, develop, and execute automated test scripts.




Power Apps Test Analyst **Responsibilities:**

Collaborate with development teams to understand project requirements and acceptance criteria.
Work with Selenium,. C# and Power Apps.
Execute test scripts, analyse results, and report defects.
Work closely with stakeholders to prioritise testing activities and ensure timely resolution of issues.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of testing processes and methodologies.




Power Apps Test Engineer **Requirements:**

Proven experience as an Automation Test Analyst, preferably within the healthcare or NHS sector.
Experience with C#, Selenium & Microsoft Power Apps
Experience with test automation frameworks.
Azure cloud
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities.




Apply now.

Title: Senior Cryptography Engineer
Description:
Stott & May are looking to speak with experienced Cryptography Engineers to assist with the build and scale out of cryptographic operations within a Financial Services client.




Type: Contract/freelance – Initially 6 months | Awaiting IR35 determination

Day Rate: TBC – Market rate for this type of role

Location: Hybrid working – Some availability to work in London or Yorkshire offices advantageous




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Responsibilities:




Cryptography and Key Management
Facilitate the adoption and use of cryptographic capabilities
Contribute to implementing and operationalising secure key storage mechanisms
Assist with the implementation of cryptography processes across the team
Enable the build of secure products
Support ongoing audit and assurance activities around key protection standards
Work with the Platform Team in building pipelines (cryptography operations)
Key generation and distribution
Close collab with Cyber and InfoSec teams - integrating key management practices




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Technical:




Experience in key handling, segregation of duties
Detailed knowledge and understanding of how to respond to cryptography incidents
Previous knowledge working within a Cryptographic team
Certificate Management.
Solid understanding of HSM technologies & Thales would be great however, other (similar) competing technologies will be just fine
HashiCorp Vault experience and previous usage of would great
Solid grasp of various types of encryptions
File/Folder level encryption, database file encryption and application encryption
Communication, problem-solving, documentation, and presentation skills
Security & compliance frameworks/standards for cryptography (PCI-DSS, PCI-PIN, PCI-CPP, NIST, FIPS)




Senior Cryptography Engineer – Advantageous:




Software engineering and infrastructure as code
GitHub Actions and/or other potential CI/CD pipeline tooling
Security Architecture & design principles
Relevant certifications




Previous experience within Financial Services, Banking, Consumer Lending or Payments is very advantageous however, it is the experience within Key mgmt. and Cryptography that is necessary. If you have used the tooling mentioned above, you have a fantastic chance of securing this long-term contract opportunity!




Roles like these aren’t as common as they potentially will be moving forward therefore, this is a fantastic opportunity to really push your career both present and future forward – look forward to receiving your profile and discussing this in more detail.

Title: Lead Cloud Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about DevOps and eager to drive innovation in a cloud-first environment? We are a forward-thinking wealth management company dedicated to making financial advice more accessible. Enjoy the close-knit atmosphere of a smaller company with the stability and growth opportunities of a larger organization. Join us during this exciting growth period and help shape our DevOps strategy.




About Us:

We are at the forefront of wealth management, committed to providing leading-edge technology solutions. Our goal is to build the right foundations and strategy for DevOps, ensuring continuous improvement and innovation in our services.




The Role:

As the Lead DevOps Engineer, you will:

Build our DevOps engineering capability and define, evolve, and govern DevOps standards and principles.
Automate tasks from build and deployment through monitoring and alerting.
Champion a DevOps culture with automation at its core.
Support developers in building and maintaining pipelines.
Push beyond our existing baseline to introduce feature branch deployments, canary releases, and define our deploy vs release approach.
Act as the technical lead in an agile, cross-discipline squad, working with developers, SDETs, scrum masters, and product owners.
Educate and coach delivery teams to adopt a true DevOps mindset.




Key Requirements:

Demonstrable experience as a DevOps Lead in an agile organization.
Ability to clearly articulate your understanding of DevOps and DevSecOps.
Experience in driving DevOps adoption, defining best practices, and guiding developers in adhering to them.
Experience with serverless technology (Lambda, SNS, SQS)
Hands-on engineering skills in some or all of our core technical stack: TypeScript, Node.js, GitHub Actions, CircleCI, and AWS.
Preferred experience with Azure AD SSO and AWS IAM OIDC.




About You:

You are motivated by the opportunity to shape and define DevOps practices and drive their adoption. You stay updated with the latest technology developments and think beyond the obvious to explore ways to implement them.




Benefits and Perks:

Salary up to £78k
2-3 days on site per week in Leeds
25 days holiday (with the option to buy or sell 5 extra days).
4% flex fund can be taken as cash, used on benefits, or a combination of both.
Generous pension scheme – if you contribute 6%, we will contribute 15%.
Private healthcare.
Dental cover.




Join us and be a part of our innovative journey in transforming wealth management technology.

Title: Junior Software Developer C#, .Net, React Leeds £30K
Description:
Junior Software Developer (C#, .Net) - Leeds - £30K, flexible working hours, plus hybrid working, 25 days holiday + excellent training and progression!

An exciting tech company are looking for hardworking, motivated, Junior Developers to join their growing team. This is the perfect role for anyone looking to kick-start their career and work with the newest technologies, while learning and developing their own knowledge and skills along the way.

The role

Your role will encompass diverse innovative projects, spanning from crafting web applications to ensuring customer contentment. You'll be pivotal in fostering business expansion, within a collaborative team where you'll have the opportunity to propose fresh technologies and steer their technical trajectory. Success in this position requires ambition and a penchant for thriving in a dynamic, swiftly evolving sports environment.

Requirements


1 years commercial experience in C#, .Net
Have a real desire to learn and develop


Desirable


SQL server
Azure


The Company

The company have been established for 10+ years and have recenly taken on some exciting new projects. They are hiring multiple Junior Developers, with the view to progress them up the ranks, while being heavily involved with the day to day processes of Software Development. They provide specialised training opportunities, development programmes, and additional perks.

HOW TO APPLY!

If you are a Developer that is ready to take that next step in your career and feel valued by your company, this one is for you. Interviews are commencing this week so waste no time and apply now.

Junior Software Developer (C#, .Net) - Leeds - £30K, flexible working hours, plus hybrid working, 25 days holiday + excellent training and progression!

Oscar Associates (UK) Limited is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.
